ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Practice of portuguese language, much of this course focused on more oral practice as well as learning relevant vocabulary rather focusing on grammar like in L1
Cultural knowledge of Portuguese speaking countries and better language fluency.

I developed speaking and listening skills and was given the opportunity to immerse myself in Brazilian culture. In this class, I learned how to speak and understand more complex language structures by reading and discussing topics concerning Brazilian politics, Brazilian art, and Brazil's wide culture.

This course taught me how to apply my skills in portuguese. We wrote music, created our own podcast, debated on everyday subjects, watched films, consumed a variety of lusophone media, organized our own virtual art gallery, presented on lusophone poets, and created a final presentation on a topic of our choice, completely in portuguese. This course, different from PORT 110, was more about learning the vocabulary necessary to actually talk about the subjects you would discuss with someone on an everyday basis.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Strength of the course was the level of practice that students were able to attain throughout this course as well as the range of topics which are more likely to arise in conversation. Topics explored include culture, society at large, food and film, etc. which were all greatly appreciated

I really enjoyed how understanding and welcoming the prof and TAs were when many of us do not know the language very well and have questions in class or say something incorrectly. One weakness might be that it would be nice to be updated on our grades more frequently throughout the semester.

The strengths of this course were in-class discussion, outside projects such as podcasts and presentations to be presented to the class. 

As a language learner, there were many obstacles to overcome while learning a third language but they were not the fault of the material or the instructors - who helped me even more because of it.

The course had a wide variety of assignments and felt effortless, yet I improved so much. Personally, I would have liked more opportunities in class to speak portuguese, but I mainly credit the Zoom structure for this weakness.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think all succeeded. One thing that was a bit frustrating might be that when it came to our presentations they took very long to get through and got very monotonous quickly.

practices such as in-class discussions and having multiple instructors/assistants in class was extremely helpful as the discussions were live and engaging and allowed for help to be asked in real time

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely. It was a class that allowed me to gain a wider world lens and introduced me to a new language as well as its culture. I believe learning cultural backgrounds in relation to the language is extremely valuable.
Yes! This course is definitely for students who want to dive into lusophone cultures and learn how to speak portuguese in a casual and supportive setting.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
